transcripts.text: We're back on the record, CJTD 2020-1.  The court has conferenced as to the six allegations alleged in the amended petition and finds as follows.  The court finds unanimously the prosecution failed to show clear and convincing evidence that respondent committed gross neglect of duty.  The court finds unanimously the allegation of violation of the terms of probation placed by the Oklahoma Supreme Court merged with other grounds for removal.  The court finds unanimously the allegation of violation of city, state, and federal law merge with other grounds for removal.  The court finds by a vote of six to three that by clear and convincing evidence, the respondent has committed oppression in office.  The court finds by a vote of six to three by clear and convincing evidence that respondent has violated other grounds specified by the legislature, violations by a judicial officer of the code of judicial conduct to include but not limited to canons one, two, and four.  The court finds by a vote of six to three, by clear and convincing evidence that respondent violated her ethics reporting.  It is the judgment of the majority that the respondent, Kendra Coleman, be removed from the office of District Judge of District 7, Office 9 without disqualification to hold a judicial office in the future.  The court will file a written journal entry of judgment to follow.
